intro: Acinodendron hirtellum, commonly known as the hairy acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage, which give it its common name. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Acinodendron hirtellum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
